big_picture_notes: Matthew frames Jesus’ messianic ministry with five major teaching blocks, each closed by the formula 'when Jesus finished these sayings' (7:28; 11:1; 13:53; 19:1; 26:1). Literary glue includes the Kingdom of Heaven theme, pervasive fulfillment formulae linking to the Hebrew Scriptures, mountain‑theophany moments (5–7; 17; 24–25; 28), and patterned triads/dualities. The Gospel opens with royal genealogy and ends with the Great Commission (28:18–20), forming an inclusio of universal authority. The first units below follow the prologue (1–4), the first discourse (5–7), and the ensuing authority‑demonstration block (8–10).

stories.story_title: The Origin and Authorization of the King
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Prologue establishing Jesus’ identity/authority via royal lineage, miraculous birth, prophetic fulfillments, baptismal theophany, and victorious temptation; closes as public ministry commences and crowds gather. Start (1:1): genealogy title. End (4:25): summary crowd‑scope before the Sermon. Glue: clustered fulfillment formulae (2:15, 17, 23; 4:14), angelic oracles, and the Father’s voice at baptism (3:17).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Formal toldot opens; structured 14‑14‑14 generations close. Devices: numerological parallelism (David=14), royal pedigree emphasis.

scenes.scene_name: The Conception and Birth of the King
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Birth 'in this way' → Joseph’s obedient naming; Immanuel fulfillment. Devices: angelic oracle, fulfillment formula, naming motif.
After birth, Gentile sages seek the King; depart another way. Devices: royal/Gentile contrast with Herod, guided dream.

scenes.scene_name: The Flight to Egypt and Return
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Three dream oracles drive flight, return, and Nazareth settlement; closes with 'spoken by the prophets' fulfillment. Devices: tripled fulfillment formulae, commanded moves.
Wilderness preacher fulfills Isa 40:3; concludes with Spirit/Fire contrast. Devices: prophetic citation, judgment imagery (axe, chaff).
Jesus‑John dialogue resolved; heavens open and Father’s voice affirms Son. Devices: theophany, Spirit descent, sonship oracle.
Spirit leads to wilderness; triad of tests ends with devil’s departure and angelic ministry. Devices: Deuteronomy quotations, patterned triad.

scenes.scene_name: The Start of the Galilean Ministry
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: After John’s arrest Jesus moves to Capernaum (Isa 9 fulfillment), calls first disciples, and heals/teaches; crowd‑summary closes prologue. Devices: fulfillment formula, call narratives, summary inclusio.

stories.story_title: The King's Sermon and Call to Obedience
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: First major discourse (Sermon on the Mount) framed by mountain setting and the formulaic close (7:28–29). Start (5:1): Jesus sits to teach. End (7:29): authority noted. Glue: Beatitudes, six antitheses, piety triad, paired contrasts (two ways/trees/builders), and interwoven 'Father in heaven' motif.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Teaching setting; nine 'Blessed' lines end with heavenly reward. Devices: anaphora, parallelism.
Identity → vocation metaphors; ends in doxology. Devices: metaphor pair, imperative telos.

Formulaic close notes audience astonishment and Jesus’ authority. Devices: discourse colophon, authority theme.

stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Ten miracle/sign episodes (often in triads) and discipleship scenes display authority over disease, nature, demons, sin, and death, culminating in mission authorization of the Twelve. Start (8:1): descent from the mountain. End (10:42): mission instructions complete (11:1 serves as narrative colophon beyond this unit). Glue: miracle summaries, fulfillment citation (8:17), and escalating authority claims ('Son of Man has authority to forgive').

stories.story_title: Opposition and Parables of the Kingdom
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Narrative reactions to Jesus (John’s question, cities’ woes, Sabbath controversies) flow into the third major discourse—the Parables of the Kingdom—closed by the formula at 13:53. Start (11:1): discourse 2 colophon and transition to responses. End (13:53): 'when Jesus finished these parables' discursive close. Glue: escalating opposition, 'this generation' critique, Jonah/Son of Man motifs, and parabolic discourse framed by explanation sections.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: 11:1 wraps mission; John in prison inquires; signs list answers. Devices: Isaianic catalog, beatitude for the unoffended.

stories.story_title: Identity Clarified and the Community Discourse
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: From Nazareth rejection through signs and confessions to the Transfiguration, culminating in the fourth discourse on community life (ch. 18) closed by 19:1. Start (13:54): prophet in hometown rejected. End (19:1): 'When Jesus finished these sayings' transition. Glue: confessions/misunderstandings, passion predictions, and kingdom community ethics.

Glue: Passover/new covenant, passion predictions realized, and mountain commission echoing royal authority.
